title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977),
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Enterprise, Tourism and Employment
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Enterprise, Tourism and Employment 

(Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 2) Order 2025.
text_norm: 1 order may cited enterprise tourism employment (delegation ministerial functions) (no 2) order 2025

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977),
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 

the Minister for Enterprise, Tourism and Employment conferred on him – 

(a) 

by or under the enactments specified in Part 1 of the Schedule, 

(b) by or under the provisions of the enactment specified in Part 2 of 

the Schedule, and 

(c) 

under the Regulations specified in Part 3 of the Schedule, 

are delegated to Niamh Smyth, Minister of State at the Department of Enterprise, 
Tourism and Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [241] 3
text_norm: 2 power (other power prosecute offence) duty minister enterprise tourism employment conferred - (a) enactment specified part 1 schedule (b) provision enactment specified part 2 schedule (c) regulation specified part 3 schedule delegated niamh smyth minister state department enterprise tourism employment notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 6th june 2025 241 3

title: the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of 1977),
heading: Assurance Companies Act 1909 (9 Edw. 7. c. 49)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

PART 1 

Assurance Companies Act 1909 (9 Edw. 7. c. 49) 

Casual Trading Act 1995 (No. 19 of 1995) 

Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014) 

Companies (Corporate Governance, Enforcement and Regulatory Provisions) 
Act 2024 (No. 44 of 2024) 

Competition Act 2002 (No. 14 of 2002) 

Competition (Amendment) Act 2006 (No. 4 of 2006) 

Competition and Consumer Protection Act 2014 (No. 29 of 2014) 

Consumer Credit Act 1995 (No. 24 of 1995) 

Consumer Protection Act 2007 (No. 19 of 2007) 

Consumer Rights Act 2022 (No. 37 of 2022) 

Control of Exports Act 2023 (No. 27 of 2023) 

Designated Investment Funds Act 1985 (No. 16 of 1985) 

Digital Services Act 2024 (No. 2 of 2024) 

Friendly Societies Act 1896 (59 & 60 Vict. c. 25) 

Friendly Societies (Amendment) Act 1977 (No. 17 of 1977) 

Hallmarking Act 1981 (No. 18 of 1981) 

Industrial and Provident Societies Act 1893 (56 & 57 Vict. c. 39) 

Industrial and Provident Societies (Amendment) Act 1978 (No. 23 of 1978) 

Investment Funds, Companies and Miscellaneous Provisions Act 2005 (No. 12 
of 2005)

Liability for Defective Products Act 1991 (No. 28 of 1991) 

Limited Partnerships Act 1907 (7 Edw. 7. c. 24) 

Occasional Trading Act 1979 (No. 35 of 1979) 

Package Holidays and Travel Trade Act 1995 (No. 17 of 1995) 

Partnership Act 1890 (53 & 54 Vict. c. 39) 

Personal Injuries Assessment Board Act 2003 (No. 46 of 2003) 

Personal Injuries Resolution Board Act 2022 (No. 42 of 2022) 

Registration of Business Names Act 1963 (No. 30 of 1963) 

Registry of Friendly Societies Act 1936 (No. 51 of 1936) 

Representative Actions for the Protection of the Collective Interests of 
Consumers Act 2023 (No. 22 of 2023) 

 
 4 [241] 

Sale of Goods Act 1893 (56 & 57 Vict., c. 71) 

Sale of Goods and Supply of Services Act 1980 (No. 16 of 1980) 

Sale of Tickets (Cultural, Entertainment, Recreational and Sporting Events) Act 
2021 (No. 21 of 2021) 

Screening of Third Country Transactions Act 2023 (No. 28 of 2023) 

Unit Trusts Act 1990 (No. 37 of 1990) 

PART 2 

Section 142(2) of the Irish Collective Asset-management Vehicles Act 2015 
(No. 2 of 2015) 

PART 3 

Companies Act 1990 (Uncertificated Securities) Regulations 1996 (S.I. No. 68 
of 1996) 

Competition Act 2002 (Adjudication Officers) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 476 
of 2023) 

European Communities (Admissions to Listing and Miscellaneous Provisions) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 286 of 2007) 

European Communities (Aerosol Dispensers) Regulations 1977 (S.I. No. 144 of 
1977) 

European Communities (Directive 2000/31/EC) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 68 
of 2003) 

European Communities (European Economic Interest Groupings) Regulations 
1989 (S.I. No. 191 of 1989) 

European Communities (European Public Limited Liability Company) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 21 of 2007) 

European Communities (Food Imitations) (Safety) Regulations 1991 (S.I. No. 
265 of 1991) 

European Communities (Intra-Community Transfers of Defence Related 
Products) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 346 of 2011) 

European Communities (Labelling of Footwear) Regulations 1996 (S.I. No. 63 
of 1996) 

European Communities (Safety of Toys) Regulations 2011 (S.I. No. 14 of 2011) 

European Union (Anti-Money Laundering: Beneficial Ownership of Corporate 
Entities) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 110 of 2019) 

European Union (Appliances Burning Gaseous Fuels) Regulations 2018 (S.I. 
No. 126 of 2018) 

 
 
 
 
 [241] 5 

European Union (Contestable and Fair Markets in the Digital Sector) 
Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 117 of 2024) 

European Union (Foreign Subsidies Distorting the Internal Market) Regulations 
2024 (S.I. No. 258 of 2024) 

European Union (Simple Pressure Vessels) Regulations 2016 (S.I. No. 227 of 
2016) 

Decimal Currency (Friendly Society and Industrial Assurance Contracts) 
Regulations 1971 (S.I. No. 64 of 1971) 

Transparency (Directive 2004/109/EC) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 277 of 2007) 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

4 June, 2025. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [241]
